experience: You and Ayodele both know Ryan Middleton, Christopher Porter, and 1 other
You and Ayodele are both in the Northern Arizona University Alumni Association group
Quality Assurance Assistant Graduate Intern Careers at Intel in San Jose, CA

I taught Basic Circuits Laboratory. I introduced basic concepts of electrical engineering to students and how to use simple equipment such as the function generator, oscilloscope, protoboard, and digital multi-meter. I gave useful hints that will allow students understand the basic concepts of engineering circuits. I also graded the students lab.The knowledge acquired by the students were used as leverage in higher level classes.Most of the students had excellent grades.

Lab Aide for the following undergraduate courses: Computer Engineering, Signals and Systems and Digital Logic. The guidance and assistance I provided to the students, helped a lot of them gained confidence in designing, modeling, analyzing and troubleshooting engineering systems using both hardware and software.  Course Grader for the following senior and graduate level courses: Error-Correcting Codes and Random Signals and Systems.
Providing meaningful assistance to students during the lab sessions and grading of lab reports and homework for undergraduate classes.

I collected, analyzed and simulated of research data. The data sampled was a model of environmental parameters such as temperature, humidity, light intensity, soil salinity level and water level.The research was sponsored by National Science Foundation (NSF) and the research paper was submitted to IEEE selection committee for publication.

Manage and maintained the power system for the plant.Track public utility consumption and ensure prompt payment.Standby Technician for emergency responseDepartment education and training representative
Vice President African Students Association (ASA), College of Engineering, Forestry & Natural Sciences (CEFNS) Ambassador

My desire to acquire higher educational degree and more engineering skills brought me to Northern Arizona University (NAU) in Spring 2010 as a transfer student from Nigeria. The transition process as expected was challenging but with my passion to succeed, I was able to overcome majority of these challenges. After completing my undergraduate degree in May 2012, I was offered a full tuition waiver for my graduate studies in Electrical Engineering, which I accepted with  bi-weekly stipend. As a graduate assistant, I was able to develop my communication skills both verbally and written as I interact with many students on a daily basis.Northern Arizona University continues to grow in diversity every academic year by the number of international students given admission. The faculty and staffs also work with these international students during the challenging transition period, so that they can excel in their academic pursuit.I am an example of this success path from NAU.
Vice President African Students Association (ASA), College of Engineering, Forestry & Natural Sciences (CEFNS) Ambassador

Sheryl Howard
Ph.D, Electrical Engineering
December 12, 2014, Sheryl was Ayodele’s teacher

I highly recommend Ayodele Sonuga as a very talented electrical engineer, specializing in communications systems, error-correcting coding and random processes.  Ayo is a superb engineer, instructor and Matlab programmer.Ayodele received his BSEE in Spring 2012 from Northern Arizona University, and his MS in EE, also from NAU, in August 2014.I have known Ayodele for the last 5 years, as his instructor for 4 undergraduate courses (including Signals and Systems, Communication Systems and Error-Correcting Codes) and 3 graduate courses (including a Random Processes course and a course on compression, estimation and cryptography), his undergraduate research supervisor, and his masters thesis advisor.  Ayo is a quick learner and easily grasps abstract theoretical concepts.  He excels at both theory and lab work, as well as programming.Ayo is very good at explaining difficult concepts to students, and was one of our top lab teaching assistants (TAs) in EE.  He was a lab TA for NAU's freshman circuits lab course for several semesters, and did such an excellent job that the EE program hired Ayo to teach that course during the summer in 2013 and 2014.  He was a very good lab instructor, a natural teacher who was very responsive to student questions, and worked hard to improve his English skills to facilitate student understanding.  As a graduate student, Ayo was also a lab TA for the Digital Logic course and the Matlab programming labs in our Signals and Systems course for three years. I supervised Ayo in the Matlab labs, where he was an excellent lab TA, patient and helpful with the students.  His strong understanding of Matlab allowed Ayo to quickly determine where students were having difficulties and assist them in converting their knowledge of course concepts into code.  Ayo was always very well prepared for his labs, and very reliable; he would do the labs himself the week before to ensure that he understood them well and could identify potential problems the students might have with the lab.Ayo was an excellent researcher for his masters thesis work as well as earlier, as an undergraduate researcher.  His strong understanding of the theoretical aspects of his research, enthusiasm for research, and very good programming skills served him well in completing his masters thesis.  Ayo's successful thesis defense showcased his in-depth understanding of his thesis topic, and his skill at explaining abstract concepts through clarifying examples.I highly recommend Ayodele Sonuga as an electrical engineer, instructor orresearcher.

David Scott
Associate Professor at Northern Arizona University
November 4, 2014, David managed Ayodele directly

I have known Mr. Ayodele Sonuga since 2010 when he transferred to start his electrical engineering program at Northern Arizona University.  He has since graduated with both a bachelor of science and a master of science degree.  I had him in my two semester capstone design class.  From my observations in this team-based setting, he was able to communicate effectively with myself and other students and has demonstrated the ability to work without much supervision.  He contributed solidly to the team project and was a dependable team member in meeting deadlines and turning in individual assignments.  He has a solid foundation in electrical engineering and our program is geared to prepare graduates for productive careers by emphasizing project learning and hands-on laboratory experiences.  Mr. Sonuga’s personality is characterized by a willingness to accept direction as evidenced by his work for the department as an undergraduate student and as a graduate teaching assistant.  He was dependable and able to work without much supervision, as the laboratory class that he led is conducted primarily without faculty present.  He also demonstrated an ability to get along easily with both his peers and mentors and one of his strengths is working well with others.  He has demonstrated his abilities to communicate well and be a productive part of a design team.  He did very well in his coursework and in his master’s thesis research.  This demonstrated that he has a good work ethic and is able to produce, even when much is demanded of himI am happy to recommend him strongly because he will prove to be a valuable and productive electrical engineer in any organization.

summary: I am a graduate Electrical Engineer with experience in design, simulation, analyzing and validation of engineering systems. My intellectual, analytical and creative abilities are some of the strengths I utilize when confronted with challenges and these qualities usually result in my performance to exceed expectations at most times.I have developed and mastering the following skills: digital and analog communications, Matlab, VHSIC Hardware Description Language (VHDL), C++, Python, Systems Engineering, Radio Frequency (RF), Installation, Maintenance and Repair of Power Systems, R, Java, Pspice, Wireless Communications, Digital Signal Processing (DSP), Microsoft Office suite and Project Management.I am a goal-oriented individual who strives to use minimal available resources to achieve optimal results.I am passionate about breaking barriers and celebrating meaningful achievements. I love to teach people because I believe that it is also a great avenue to learn more.I cherish times used in helping others because I always count that as a great privilege.My favorite quotes are: " IF YOU THINK EDUCATION IS EXPENSIVE TRY IGNORANCE" "KNOWLEDGE IS LIGHT"I am currently seeking a full-time career development employment and willing to relocate.
name: Ayodele Sonuga
title: Instructor at Northern Arizona University
